alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 2:24PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ICE JAMS IN THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MAT-SU VALLEY... The abnormally cold temperatures the past few weeks caused ice formation on area rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat- Su valleys. This ice formation is causing ice jams, and has led to localized overflow flooding in the vicinity of the jam. Warming weather this weekend has continued to enhance ice movement on the waterways, and continued low land overflows are expected through the first part of this week. Currently, widespread ice jams are being reported on streams in Anchorage and across other waterways including Wasilla Creek. With temperatures at or above freezing, water levels may rise further due to runoff from snow melt. As the week progresses, ice jam issues should begin to subside as the warmer temperatures erode lingering ice cover, which will allow water levels to decrease.
